Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, Good Price for Downtown”
Reviews.Author: opb154
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on three separate occasions, the most recent being December 2011. The Hotel has some rooms that have been renovated and others that are in need. Ask for a room that has seen recent renovation-the second floor would be your best bet. The house is Victorian in origin but has seen additions that make it a clash of recent-modern vs. old victorian. The breakfast in the morning offers several hot and cold items that are suitable to start you day with. Coffee--find a Tim Hortons or Starbucks. The location is great for us as we always visit the Distillary district where the Christmas Festival is held each December--several blocks away but a direct route from the hotel. The area is safe but not in the heart of the action--try the Bond Place off Dundas if you want the Times Square-like lights and action. The Selby is just a few blocks off Younge but several more till you get to the shopping if that is what you seek. Basically, I rate this average across the boards. Good enough for the price and location. If you want better downtown walking action or to be pampered--stay somewhere else. If you go out front door, take a right and your next right all the way to Younge-cross the street to the falafel shop and you will find one of the best falafel sandwiches in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great buy for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Cancuk12
Reviews.Content: We picked this place through Expedia because we liked the whole converted 1800s mansion feel of the place. The reviews were good and the price was solid. Check in was smooth despite a series of booking changes on our end due to a snow storm. Service was great, they helped us out by holding our luggage after we checked out so we could trek to Oshawa for a concert, sparing us another nights hotel. They also offer a complimentary breakfast every morning, a public desktop PC with printer and on-site laundry. The room itself was very clean and modern, with a very nice bathroom (complete with walk-in shower), a mounted flat screen TV and a fairly strong WiFi signal. Apparently the hotel had undergone upgrading in some areas and the quality of the rooms varies, so if that's the case we lucked out. The location is pretty awesome, we were close to pretty much everything. The Eaton Centre, Cineplex Odeon, Hall of Fame etc are all within a $10 cab ride or 10-20 minute walk. There were restaurants, shopping, a grocery store, drug store, convenience stores and a Tim's within two minutes. So yeah, I would recommend this place to anyone looking for an affordable, comfortable, clean and quiet hotel close to all amenities with plenty of nearby entertainment options.

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice for downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: kathiejoblin
Reviews.Content: The rooms were beautiful, modern, well equipped, although the hotel is a Victorian mansion. The location close to the subway was very convenient. The breakfast was a little disorganized -- seemed to be short staffed. Really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “downtown at a reasonable rate”
Reviews.Author: Rbl222
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for one night on Nov 23, 2011. There are two options of rooms, the updated ones (very nice, European feel) and the older rooms (still clean and large). We opted for the cheaper room at $71.99 with my CAA discount - quite a good rate for close to Yonge and Bloor and right near the subway. The room was on the lower level with light from a light shaft into a sun room next to it, but at least it was quite quiet. The continental breakfast was nothing exciting but sufficient. Parking was an additional $17 but they did let me leave the vehicle until 2 the next day. Front desk staff were all polite and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “pleased with the service”
Reviews.Author: kaaljkmn
Reviews.Content: Friendly hotel, large beds, spacious rooms, helpful staff, free use of computer and local telephone, excellent location

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Irony: terrible value old rooms; fantastic value new rooms;”
Reviews.Author: Boriski
Reviews.Content: In summary - this hotel is a bit of an irony - we paid the same rates (ave $119 per night incl. tax) for an older dark, noisy room as we did for one of the newly appointed, quiet, super comfortable rooms. Ratings provided are based on the renovated rooms. TIP - ring when booking or before you arrive to ensure you get allocated a room on the upper floors (above first floor) in the upgraded section - or else give the place a complete miss. We booked online through one of the common hotel booking sites for a five night stay, and read previous tripadvisor reviews (and unfortunately missed comments about old vs new rooms) but did note there were some rooms in the basement with no windows and so requested an upper floor room in our booking request. It was unclear whether our request was overlooked or unable to be met and we were issued a room key on check-in for a basement level room (first floor rooms are in the basement), and so requested a change to an upper floor room, which was met. The room we stayed in for the first two nights was on the fourth floor, in the old section. I'm generally okay with staying in older, less fancy hotels providing the nightly rate refelcts that. This was probably one of the least value for money rooms I've ever stayed in, in years of travel for business and pleasure. Hemmingway apparently once stayed here and whilst this might be romantic and quirky history, unfortunately it doesn't now make for a good value or a comfortable stay. The bathroom was reasonable (probably a 1980's refurb?) with shower pressure a little weak. The room was dark, with older-style furniture and linen. The floor in our room had such a lean on one side that it was actually awkward doing work at the desk. Coffee machine in-room. I requested a room change to a newer room later in our first day that was unable to be accommodated. We were curtly informed we'd booked a queen room, and that was what we'd received. Unfortunately we had two nights of very interrupted sleep due to a noisy elevator and pretty thin walls (and we mostly sleep with earplugs). After doing some receptionist-shopping on the second day, our request of changing to a newer room was able to be accommodated and was much appreciated. Our change to a newer room was like moving hotels. The newer room was larger, almost soundproof, warmer and tastefully decorated. A large leather bedhead, nice linen, a very comfortable bed (pillows still a little on the lumpy, flat-pancake scale) and a strong, hot shower. Free wifi was much stronger in the new section also. Breakfast is served in the front rooms of the old part of the hotel, and was included in the price. It's available from 7 until 10 (I think), and is a standard continental style. A subway station (Sherbourne) is almost diagonally across the road from the Hotel, and we found it easy to get from the Central VIA train station (one changeover). Subway costs around $3 per person, per trip (transfers included). Cheaper to buy multiple tokens (10 for $25). The subway makes for easy access to various tourist places around Toronto. Plenty of fast food outlets, coffee shops and convenience stores nearby. Parking is available at the front of the hotel in open-air bays for $17 a night. The fire alarm went off during our stay and was attended by three engines and a support vehicle. We weren't evacuated however it might be useful for management to review evacuation procedures. We spoke with the fireman to clarify safety concerns. The older-style lift broke down for the last three days of our stay however there are several sets of stairs in the building. A drink and ice machine are available in the basement, as well as a convenient guest laundry on the ground floor for a small fee. Staff helpfulness/friendliness was dependent on the individual. One did not endear himself to us by suggesting that the old and new rooms were of the same standard, and giving us the impression he resented us moving. Would stay in the new rooms again.

Reviews.Title: “Full of history and character, and cheap parking!”
Reviews.Author: Quebec_Yankee
Reviews.Content: They left the historic character in this old mansion when they turned it into a hotel. Antique furniture, crown moldings, fireplaces, and decor. Hemmingway lived in the house back in the day, so there are many Hemmingway named suites, and you can almost feel papa in the place. Old antique elevator, so if you have mobility issues be careful. We took the stairs most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: djweston
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Clarion for one night. Great location but noisy. Service was polite and room was adequate. Nothing fancy but good value. .

Reviews.Title: “could be old and charming, but instead it's old and tired”
Reviews.Author: jj9
Reviews.Content: This hotel has two parts: the old 1880s house, and a later addition. Location is great (quiet and a half-block from Sherbourne subway) and there is onsite parking. The reception area is a good renovation of the Victorian high-ceilinged parlor, but the renovation doesn't reach the hotel hallways or (apparently) a number of the rooms or the elevator. The worst problem is the clinging musty/sour smell everywhere but the reception area and breakfast room. I was upgraded to a suite, which was not a worthwhile bonus. The room was vast, but in the old part of the hotel and seriously neglected (the smell I mentioned above, poor quality plaster repairs, badly installed 80s vinyl hotel wallpaper, ugly mismatched curtains). Likely to be cold in winter (there were two baseboard heaters, but not controllable by the guest, who could only get heat from the window A/C unit). No attention to detail by housekeeping: the room was mostly clean, but vacuuming did not reach baseboards, some lights were not working, refrigerator and microwave were plugged into a defective adapter and not getting power, so I had to haul them away from the wall to correct the problem. Internet access instructions incorrect (they're in a loose-leaf binder, so why not change them?). Breakfast was great considering it was free, but served on disposable everything (plates, cups, utensils). I found the staff friendly, but I get the impression that the management has given up on the place, so I did not report the problems in my room except on the comment card when I left. Overall, fair value for money, but if you spend more than the minimum amount of time in the hallways (and perhaps your room if it is like mine) the musty smell will drive you crazy. With some investment of time and cash, this could be an appealing hotel (not a concrete box that looked like all the others), but at the moment it's just a place to sleep and shower, definitely not linger in.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: mntcrst
Reviews.Content: Take care of your fingers when opening the elavator gate,The vicinity of the hotel is not safe..We're trav'ling from california to visit our friends in toronto and stay in the hotel for one night and a night to remember, somebody broke-in to our car for shopping only to get $100 navigator and some kids cloths...the cost for repair is $850 for window glass...The management of the hotel seems ready for that situition and they have number for auto glass repair to offer you....BEWARE OF THIS HOTEL...

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money. ( Request a renovated room)”
Reviews.Author: Hfxmallard
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the night of October 12th, 2011. We have read the reviews and called in to make our reservation, frount desk helpful an polite. If you are going to stay here get a renovated room as the older rooms are just that....old. A few deficiencies in our room ( Faucet loose, paint chips on trim) but for $100 you are getting your moneys worth. Parking is $17 plus tax, good spaces however you can park a block over ( 4 mins walk) for $10-$15. Neighbourhood is average, 1 block west $1M homes, 1 block east abandoned homes. It's the city!. Close to everything, good value. If you want the Ritz...stay at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “A descent hotel”
Reviews.Author: parimalk
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a week. It is a nice clean hotel with rooms having all the basic amenities which you need when outside at very affordable rates. The staff was also nice and friendly. Rooms are tidy and quiet (although little bit small) so that you can have nice sleep at night.

Reviews.Title: “It's what you expect from a renovated Victorian House! Not too shabby at all”
Reviews.Author: dinh-traveler
Reviews.Content: Personally, I loved this place. Depending on where your room is located, it is possible to easily sleep. It is an older renovated house which I do find fit as a hotel. I find it cozy and comfortable. The people are very nice despite it's slow service at times. The hotel is slightly modern but with some outdated designs. The parking lot is quite tight and small. But so far the sheets and blankets have smelled and felt comfortable. nothing is over-bleached yet! I honestly, do like this cozy little place because it's more intimate, old-fashioned visually. But inside my room it has never felt creepy or less than expected. It is considered one of my favourite hotels in toronto for such a cheap price where I had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “O. M. G. A present day flophouse!”
Reviews.Author: grandmaholly
Reviews.Content: Who knew that the trashy kind of hotels you read about in trashy novels still exist? Clarion ought to be ashamed of themselves, associating their name with this dump! Bored staff: check. Peeling wallpaper: check. Musty linens: check. In room bugs: check. Lots of noise: check. On site drug dealers: check. Just a few years ago the Selby had turned around and become a decent, affordable renovated mansion/hotel on the subway line. Never the Ritz, it has now reverted to the flophouse it was before Clarion took it over.

Reviews.Title: “My stay was great (but only because I had a renovated room)”
Reviews.Author: Michael255093
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the other reviews listed here, it seems the older rooms are not so fantastic. I noted when walking to my room that the carpet suddenly changed from worn rug to plush new carpet, signalling arrival at the renovated section, where I was fortunate enough to have been accommodated. The bed was large and comfortable, the furniture new and clean. The room had it's own reverse cycle airconditioner. The ensuite bathroom was pretty spacious and very clean. There is breakfast included in the room rate, which consists of cereal, some pastries, toast, coffee and juice. I was very happy with it. So in all, if you could replicate my stay, you should be very happy with this hotel (but make sure to read some of the other reviews listed here in case you are housed in a room that hasn't been updated).

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel, but needs work”
Reviews.Author: Carolyw
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ok..but needs lots of work..the bathrooms were clean, but old and badly in need of upgrading..faucets leaked and bathtub had a curved bottom and could be dangerous. Hard to take a shower. window air-conditioners in rooms, no air in the rest of the hotel. convenient to subway and bus. Don't think I'd stay there again. The elevator was a funky little cage that only held 2 or 3 people. Hard to get in and out of with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable & unique!”
Reviews.Author: JoannainLA
Reviews.Content: My friend & I stayed in one of the more modern rooms. It was comfortable & quiet. Great breakfast spread in the morning. Access to Internet came in real handy. Staff was friendly & accommodating. Good location but a fair walking distance to touristy stops. Really enjoyed our stay! Felt safe & secure.

Reviews.Title: “Reality by far did not meet expectation”
Reviews.Author: hrr_11
Reviews.Content: Room with hardly any daylight, very noisy with people pulling their trolleys over a wooden floor just outside room starting at 6 A.M. and furniture breaking apart. A truly bad and disappointing hotel, definitely not to recommend. Very little value for money. The proximity to the subway could be mentioned as a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great! No Complaints!”
Reviews.Author: TanyaOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 9 days while on a business trip. Location is great, especially given that there is a subway station a stone's throw away. The rooms are freshly renovated,modern looking, have flat screen TVs, comfortable beds and free wi-fi. Staff is very kind. I didn't have a fridge in my room, and when I asked for one, it only took a few minutes and they brought one up. Breakfast is complimentary, but basic. Cereal, eggs, toast...The only thing bad I would have to say is that their website advertises a 'state of the art gym' which is laughable given that there are 3 machines in a tiny room in the basement. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible accomodations, staff, and insect bites”
Reviews.Author: Drew_Tube
Reviews.Content: I booked at the Clarion Hotel Selby first for the location and secondly because Clarion is supposed to be the business class option for Choice Hotels. Slightly more money for higher comfort. Boy was I wrong on that second bit. I reserved a room with a queen sized bed for an anniversary trip. I checked in and right away I was shocked to find my room in the bowels of the building. I passed air conditioning units on the ground and my view out my window was one of a cleaning cart in an adjoining hallway which did not move my entire stay. On top of this I did not have the queen sized bed which was guaranteed by booking through the hotel but I had a double bed. I knew the hotel also had double beds available from my time booking so I figured this was a simple mistake. I didn't use a thing and went down to the desk straight away to find another guest debating a similar story with the manager on duty. After he stomped off. I tried my luck. The only response the manager on duty gave was that the room I was given was the proper room (despite the listing on my reservation). He kept saying I had a queen sized bed in the room. I tried explaining the size difference (double bed sleeps two children/ queen bed sleeps two adults) and that I had stayed in about a half dozen hotels in Toronto with queen sized beds before but no dice. He wouldn't even come down or send someone down as asked. Why is this person managing a hotel? I just don't know. Fast forward to that night trying to make a go of it because of inability to find room anywhere else and I notice dead mosquitoes in my shower, no batteries for the remote control, inability to connect to the internet, TV picture & sound fuzzy, and the hardest mattress we've ever slept on. Tried calling for new batteries for the remote and though I was told someone would be right down, nobody ever came. My wife and I drifted in and out of sleep for 4 hours only to wake up covered in bug bites which swelled to the size of welts (I had it bad but my wife literally had 9 bites up and down her arm.) Could not bear to even try the breakfast and ran out. I am currently disputing the charge with my credit card company.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at this hotel if you wish to be in the heart of the city, close to everywhere, and have pleasant accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Maureen_Inverary
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff are always welcoming and sensitive to my needs as a guest. I've stayed at this hotel several times and it remains my first choice as a place to stay. There are always improvements with recent major renovations making our stay a truly boutique hotel experience downtown in the heart of the city. The hotel is a two minute walk from the subway and just one short block from Bloor Street and several restaurants. When you stay at this hotel you' walk into the main foyer on lovely dark wooden floors and I always have the sense that I'm in an elegant old Toronto home. The breakfast items are varied and substantial and the seating area is comfortable, well maintained and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst hotel I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: CincinnatiMichelle
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel for a trip with friends, and I must say it was one of the worst experiences of my life. I expected it to be nice, but when our group arrived it was a different story. The rooms were nothing more than small and out of date. The tv set was really old and had horrific reception. The wallpaper was peeling off of the walls. All I had were cold showers , it took forever to get hot water. The service was pretty crappy, compared to a lot of other places. The hallways were really creepy, I felt as if I was in a different time period. To sum things up, it was basically a wretched slum that I will never, ever stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Basement Blues”
Reviews.Author: 19Carlos59
Reviews.Content: The Clarion's location is unquestionably ideal. Literally steps from the Sherbourne subway station which connects you to the downtown core and Boor St. within a few stops. I stayed two nights. The second night was comfortable but the first night was a disaster. I requested to be transferred to another room after a miserable sleepless night in one of the creepy hotel basement rooms. Although told that I was actually given a room on the first floor, the room was actually in the basement. The front desk will try (unsuccessfully) to convince you otherwise. The alarm bells sounded off when I passed what appeared to be a cluster of dirty, abandoned airconditioning units on the way to my room. Along another wall, I saw some suspicious looking cartons scattered on the floor. I had no idea what they were doing there, but since we were in the basement, maybe that's where they store things like that. My room was unattractive and cramped. It had a peculiar odour. The carpet was dirty. My sock got stuck to something sticky on the carpet. The bathroom looked old and in need of some serious upgrading or renovating. When I complained at the front desk, I was told there weren't any other rooms available but that I could switch to another room the next day. I did exactly that, but spend a sleepless night in the basement due to the creepiness of the room and the light penetrating the room from the hallway. The hallway was noisy until late. The next morning, I left my luggage at the front desk and looked forward to getting a new room. An employee at the front desk was pleasant and stored my luggage. Later in the day, I was given a beautiful room on the 4th floor in a newly revovated section where I spent a comfortable night. It was clean, spacious, had a flat screen tv attached to a wall opposite the bed which had excellent reception of all cable channels. I point this out because the room in the basement had and old tv with lousy reception. Despite the beautiful modern bathroom, the shower did not appear to have any hot water. The sink had plenty of hot water, though. And despite my dissatifaction with the basement room, the hotel employees never apologized for the misrable night I spent in the basement nor did they give me a refund for the first night which I would have appreciated. I was happy to be transferred to a section of the 4th floor that was newly renovated but wished I had never spent a night in that awful room. You should be aware that at this stage, there is still more renovating going on in the hotel so be sure to request a room in the revovated section(s). I am recommending this hotel but be sure to make it clear that you will not accept being given a room in the basement.

Reviews.Title: “Very shabby!”
Reviews.Author: Penner246
Reviews.Content: Very old hotel, nice old appeal. Rooms are very small and need to be updated. We had an appointment at st michaels hospital the next day, so this location was good for that. If your just looking for a cheap place to sleep this is it. But expect nothing else. The men at the front desk had personalities like wooden boards. But the lady at breakfast was very nice and efficient!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and excellent service and its a Hotel with History”
Reviews.Author: Amber031
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 weeks me and my 20 yr old daughter. It is right beside the subway, to it is very easy to get anywhere. The building is rich with history, Ernest Hemmingway stayed there. The rooms could use some updating but for $60 a night with a breakfast, it was an excellant! The breakfast is bothcold and hot, not huge. The breakfast also has a very cute sunroom to eat in with veiw of the street. The hotel also had an old fashioned elevator. We only had one problem which they fixed right away, I booked a room with2 beds and they booked us a room with one. They fixed it right away and with a smile. I loved it because of the rich history and general feel of the hotel. I would reccomand it to anyone! And the beds are very comfy, I slept excellent.

Reviews.Title: “It was like staying at Moms”
Reviews.Author: jrmunch
Reviews.Content: Love the old style architecture. Our room was not to great and as we were talking to the staff they right away without asking upgraded our room. It was fantastic. The beds were top notch. The staff was friendly and helpful. They seemed sincere in caring that everything was ok. We stayed 2wks. The buffet breakfast was delicious. After that we would go visiting or site seeing. Front desk was always there to wish us a good time and greet us when we came back. If I could find a hotel like this everywhere I went and for the great price I would be in 7th heaven. This is the first time in my life (I'm68) that I have be treated so well.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Bolly74
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights here and no complaints. Huge room, super comfy beds, lovely and warm (it really needed to be!), nice powerful shower, clean, plentiful breakfast and handy location. What more could you ask for?!

Reviews.Title: “Get everything in print. Or take a picture of your statement.”
Reviews.Author: wotnots
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay and the hotel management quoted me a price on the phone, as well as emailed me a confirmation about the room price and the check-out time When I checked-in, everything was fine. The hotel clerk was very nice and verified that I could check out at 3pm with NO extra charges -this was in print: late check out, no charge. I signed their agreement and asked for a copy. The clerk said that they do not give out copies. If I could go back in time, I would have photographed this statement and taken the name of the clerk. The next day, I received a phone call from the front desk (another clerk) stating that I had to "please check out at 11 am." When I arrived at the front desk and explained the arrangement, I was told that the clerk from the night before gave me misinformation, that he did not know better, that he would never make such an arrangement, that they have to get in touch with him to verify this. Then I was told by the new clerk that he could not allow me to stay until 3pm because they could "sell the room for more and that would be smart business from a business man's point of view" I could not believe what I was hearing. When I said that I would report this to the head office, he told me that that would be the best thing to do in this situation since he could not do anything. Ironically, in their hotel book, it clearly states that guests should go to the front desk to have all their problems resolved. The front desk clerk told me that the manager was not on site. I stated that I was promised over the phone and in last night's statement that they printed -- I could stay until 3pm no charge. They never gave me a copy of the agreement that they typed up the night before -they only filed it away. When they checked their records, they stated that they had no such arrangement in place, but they refused to let me see the paper or give me a copy. Shockingly, I was yelled at in a very hostile manner. I am a visitor and who needs to go about my business and the last thing I need is this type of service. Their behaviour caught me off guard. I told the front desk person that it was wrong to not honour their arrangement if their rationale is selling the room to make more money - I don't mind paying extra if that I was I agreed to and if that is what I was informed of in the first place. But instead he yelled at me and told me my only option was to pay if I want the extra hours. I checked out. There's no reason for this type of treatment. You can't manipulate the agreement and then intimidate your guests to pay extra. I didn't know whether to call the cops or not. Wherever I go from now, I will always request a copy of their statement that they make guest sign. And if they refuse, I'll take a picture of the statement. If my signature goes on a piece of paper, I have a right to get a copy and a right to see the paper. End of story. Also, later that week, I was double-charged for the room. When I called my credit card company, they flagged the extra charge as an unrecognized amount. When I called the hotel, they told me that was not a real charge and that I should not worry about it, that it would disappear. I told them what my credit card company told me and that I would like this resolved. Within a few days, the hotel reversed the charge and they were very apologetic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value,Excellent Customer Service,Nourishing Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Marblehead10
Reviews.Content: The value of this interesting Victorian Hotel was amazing. $89.00 a night for a private room and breakfast, free internet service, laundry facilities and charming victorian decorating make this the place to stay whenever I am in Toronto. The excellent customer service was amazing, the manager even offered a cup of warm milk to the person traveling with me, who mentioned she had difficulty sleeping due to an illness.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Resuri
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 days in July while I was in the city for a concert. I had stayed at this hotel before (in February), and decided to stay again since I would receive Aeroplan points for staying there. The room I got was on the 1st floor very close to the elevator. I was woken up every time someone used the elevator because it's old and is very noise. Also, one of the locks on my door was broken, so at night I had to put a chair in front of my door just in case. That, coupled with the air conditioner that kept on cycling throughout the night, made for a very restless 4 nights for me. I can't really comment about the food, because I did not eat the continental breakfast at all while I was there, and I had no dealings with the staff aside from check-in/out. My room was cleaned adequately every day, although the room and bathroom are quite old and in need of updating (new paint, etc). Anyway, for the money I spent to stay there, I would expect better. I don't think I'll be staying there again when I go back to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not great”
Reviews.Author: Kurona84
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a long weekend trip to Toronto. Keep in mind that this really is just an old mansion. A lot of it seems like you're walking into an old house. The staff was average...not great, but not horrible. They were a bit slow, however. The location wasn't the best, but if you're used to big cities, you'll be fine. The subway was located about a half to full block away. The rooms were pretty basic, we didn't have a fridge or microwave (this may have changed since we stayed there over a year ago). I believe they charged for parking (I could be wrong on this.) Overall, I had no major complaints.

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Option”
Reviews.Author: Bouchard79
Reviews.Content: Overall this motel is not a bad option. The location is very good, 1 block from the subway station and bloor street shopping. The hotel itself is old, but it is adequately maintained. The rooms were clean, but small and somewhat noisey at times. Breakfast was okay; boiled eggs, cereals, toast, tea/coffee, croissants, etc. I would give this hotel a 3.25/5.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: mosaiclady
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I wound up here at the last minute after a mix-up at another place nearby. We got a decent room for 129.00, although we might have got a better rate through one of the hotel sites, but it was last-minute, late and raining. Our room was clean and quiet-bathroom the same (shower was smallish), decent tv, pleasant and helpful desk staff. Location is excellent-subway stop across the street-15 min. to downtown. Free wifi. This hotel is in what used to be an old mansion, and for me, that adds to the ambience. Limited eating options nearby-a Tim Hortons, no-frills supermarket, breakfast cafe, that's it. The hotel's continental breakfast was standard-pastries,cereal,juices, but they did have hardboiled eggs and a waffle maker. I would stay here again, especially if I could get a lower rate. Also, thanks to the desk staff for letting us use the microwave to heat up a couple of frozen dinners.

Reviews.Title: “not very good”
Reviews.Author: samgill
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel last week (aug 2010) as i was in toronto for an exam... hence i chose it in the first place as it was very close to the exam center. but the service was not good. the front desk staff is very rude and unprofessional. i asked for a 2 hour extension for my check out as i will be in my exam and needed to freshen up before heading to the airport to catch my flight back home. the manager made a very big fuss about it and spoke in a very rude tone. finally though he agreed and i accepted the extension, i still felt quite insulted (dont think I am being racist, as I am also of south asian descent). also the room was very small. the A/C kept tripping the whole night, i had to use just the fan in the A/C for the remainder of the night. the breakfast was sufficient, though disposable cutlery was not very appealing. internet worked fine and so did the TV and the wake up service. the hotel served my purpose for the night and its proximity to my exam center, but i wouldnt want to stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Mizclaudi
Reviews.Content: My overall stay was pretty good. The room, bed sheets, and towels were clean. Bed was pretty comfy, slept well. Hotel is sort of old, you can see the water damage on the ceiling, narrow hallways and tiny scary elevator. The continental breakfast was not as described on the website. It consisted of tea, coffee, cold boiled eggs, blueberry waffles, brown and white bread, croissants, and cheese biscuits. We were lucy to get apple one day. The staff were very friendly they politely answered questions and offered great tips. Location was awesome. Really close to the subway station, Tim Hortons and a bank. Price was alright for a downtown location but I don't feel like we got real value for the amount paid.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: impumkin
Reviews.Content: Wouldn't recommend anyone to stay here. Tatty rooms. Chipped paintwork. Very dated decor. Our first room was horrible. The second room we were offered wasn't much better. Champagne & strawberries ordered & paid for - never received! Staff not bothered & very lax. Dining room is in the basement. Paper tablecloths, disposable paper plates & plastic cutlery! Garbage bins next to 'buffet' (that's a joke) table. Absolutely terrible. Ruined our stay in Toronto. Stayed here Oct 2007

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: WeirsBeachGuy
Reviews.Content: Good location - short walk to subway! Pretty easy to drive to & from QEW. Off-street parking (at extra charge). Breakfast was fine. Room was spacious & clean. Would stay again & recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Back to my college dorm room - before it was done over!”
Reviews.Author: MedCommChick
Reviews.Content: The good: The younger fellow at the front desk during the day. Knows what customer service is all about. Ordered me a taxi, recommended some places for me to see in my limited spare time, and was all around helpful. What a find! The place also has tremendous potential - but that is far from realized. The bad: This hotel has had several lives and looks the part. The website is a complete misrepresentation of what the hotel is really like. The rooms are small, dingy, inefficiently heated. There is no heating or cooling unit in the bathroom. Early APril is abad time of year to not have heat after your shower. My appointments consisted of a peeling windowsill, a patched up (but not painted) wall, chairs with cigarette burns in them, and a construction sit for a view. Being a New Yorker, the construction didn't bother me much. The strange odors, and attitude of the management that this is "an old hotel" when I complained about a lack of cleanliness in my room was not helpful. To his credit, he did make it right, But I had to make him see what I was talking about! As for this being an old hotel, I have been in many in NY that are about as old, and maintained to a very high standard. Which clearly this isn't and won't be with such a rather boneheaded attitude! This place could have lots of potential if lovingly restored. It now reminds me of my college dorms before they were refurbished. Get the idea? Too bad because some parts have enormous ceilings, tin panels, stained glass, wide staircases..the makings of a lovely place in the hands of a person dedicated to customer service and not greed. The ugly: Ah yes. The old let's charge the credit card for bogus incidentals trick. I should have realized that when they took a $50 "deposit" they swore would be refunded upon my departure.It wasn't . They charged me an extra 100 (for a total of 150 CAD) for a "damaged bedspread". They assert some inky stuff got on it. It could well have--I was packing and in a hurry but geez!!! Gimme a break!!! And of course, I was told it would be 150 bucks to replace an old, dingy, scratchy bedcover made of cheap, shiny fabric that felt like fiberglass. Sure it costs that much........and I have a bridge to sell you!!! Bottom line - stay away. I am sure that an airport hotel would deliver better service than this place. Which is too bad, because I enjoyed chatting with the employees. It's too bad that their management is clueless!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, but a little long in the tooth”
Reviews.Author: psujack2007
Reviews.Content: This was a very unique hotel that had lots of plusses and lots of minuses. The staff was friendly and allowed me to check in early. The atmosphere is kind of funky and it has a certain charm. The rooms are fairly small and the amenities are average at best. Since it is an old Victorian mansion, there are some flourishes such as crown molding, stained glass windows, tin ceilings, etc. The carpets, linens and draperies all need to be replaced as they are showing signs of wear. I would not recommend this place to handicapped people for a host of reasons. No ramp to get in front door, elevators shut down in the evening, narrow hallways, etc. Location is very good with dozens of attractions within walking distance and nearby subway access. Parking is a nightmare here with tight parking areas and if you check in late you don't get a space at all. Price was good for Toronto standards, but you tend to get what you pay for. I did not hate this place but I did not love it either.

Reviews.Title: “Charming old hotel, close to subway”
Reviews.Author: Resuri
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during the last week of February. It's a nice, old hotel with friendly staff, free wi-fi connection, and free continental breakfast. It's also got a really nifty elevator (think closing gate elevators from the Titanic movie), though I'm not sure it would be considered accessible to an elderly person or someone with a disability. Please be aware that there is construction going on right next door to the hotel. Actually, my room was right next to the construction, but that didn't bother me because I was up very early every day anyway. What DID bother me was that the toilet in my room (419) wouldn't flush properly, and that in the 5 days that I stayed, the toilet paper roll was never replenished. Breakfast was very basic, but alright. There was cereal, fruit, toast/bagles, etc. available. I only ate there twice and decided to go elsewhere for a more heartier breakfast. I would recommend this hotel because of it's cheap price and it's location. It's only a 2 minute walk from Sherbourn Station, which made it super easy to get to from Pearson Airport (I took the airport bus that dropped me off at Kipling Station, and then the subway took me right to my hotel. It only cost me $2.00 to do it, versus a taxi or expensive shuttle). While I didn't find much entertainment value in the immediate area of the hotel, being so close to the subway meant I could get to places within 15 minutes or less.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: airdriegal
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay...the staff were very friendly..the building had character..the elevator was a bit of a challange..but the breakfast was good..but the staff made the stay...

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pawak811
Reviews.Content: I had a very comfortable stay in this hotel. I will return again and recommend to my friends, visiting Toronto to stay this place and enjoy their service and amenities. Desk service agents are very friendly and cooperative. The hotel is clean as well as Rooms and specious. Breakfast is excellent and healthy except they should add more fruits! The hotel is located 1 Block south from Sherburne station and walking distance to downtown and shopping areas. I definitely like this place due to its location, service and reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Really worth for a stay especially to stay in an old Mansion in Downtown!”
Reviews.Author: TiKToronto_ON
Reviews.Content: We booked a regular room but the front desk agent was kind enough to upgrade us for free to a suite. With a fireplace and wi-fi. Great staff and service. We enjoyed the complementary continental breakfast. I really recommend this hotel. :D

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_0929
Reviews.Content: I am not a picky traveler. I don't mind small rooms. I don't mind it's not new. But it needs to be top clean! And it was the complete opposite. I didn't feel comfortable walking without shoes on the old dirty carpet. I left tip under my pillow for the cleaning lady two days in a row, but it seems she did not even move the pillows around to make my bed because the money was still there when I came back to my room! The bathroom was really cold with no heater, and the heater in the room made so much noise... The air was also really dry. This is by far the worst hotel I have stayed at. The website shows nice images, but it's a lie. The breakfast consisted of dry bread, not so fresh bagels and sweet cereal. No fresh fruit except for apples.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel and great price!”
Reviews.Author: Bebeitalia
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very nice. Hotel room is very roomy with comfortable beds, big bathroom, big closets, fridge and microwave. It is an old building but there is a laundry room, and computer in the lobby for your use, The Staff are biligual (English and Spanish) and some cases triligual (English, Spanish and French). The area where is the hotel is located is a little iffy. There are two homeless shelters in the area so there some people begging for money. During my stay there I only saw 2 homeless people in the area. Talking to the staff at the hotel and locals they said that the area is fairly good but to becareful with people begging for money. The subway station (Shebourne) is just one block away and it is very easy to around on the subway. All in all it was a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel in down town Toronto”
Reviews.Author: RCINassau
Reviews.Content: My teenage son and I and my best friend stayed at the Selby for 7 nights and were thrilled with the bargin we found in down Town Toronto. A great little hotel with lots of charm, clean comfortable room, close and in walking distance to everything we needed to get to (resturaunts, shopping, Eatons Center, subway etc etc) and helpful friendly staff .. I mean what more could you ask for?! In addittion to providing all the basics you would expect they also have a few free perks that make staying there a definate all thumbs up in my opinion .. free wireless internet for those travelling with their own laptop in the rooms and if you don't have your own computer, they even have a free computer to use in the lobby with a printer .. Free continental breakfast which we found more then adequate (especially for FREE!) oh and a cute little hotel gym that was almost always deserted so no line ups. I would definately return to stay at the Selby on my next trip to Toronto no question about it!

Reviews.Title: “Good for price.”
Reviews.Author: poshcatlady
Reviews.Content: stayed at the clarion for 5 nights. room ok, good size storage and bathroom. construction site outside window, but we were not disturbed by this as we got up quite early most days. housekeeping was done very late and we had to make our own bed on 2 occasions as they had not cleaned our room before we returned. breakfast very basic but ample. would definately reccomend the niagara trip, great value aand a great day out.

Reviews.Title: “Basic add-on to Victorian hotel”
Reviews.Author: wanderlass
Reviews.Content: This hotel was convenient to where we were visiting so it did fit our needs. No luxury accommodations here but a good bed, big old bathroom, big closet, small room. If you are looking for a budget hotel, this is near all the big intersections of buses, subways, taxis and foot traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Not as Promised”
Reviews.Author: JRSM1THAlberta
Reviews.Content: We don't mind old - but this building needs extensive repair and renovation. The carpets throughout are threadbare and stained, the paint and wallpaper thoughout needs an update. Our room was not cleaned satisfactorily over the 4 nights we were there - the same hair elastic was in the same place on the carpet when we left as when we arrived - neither my husband or I use hair elastics. Breakfast is not as described on their website. On only one of the 4 mornings were there cold boil eggs and not once were there waffles. Fresh fruit turns out to be apples each time and the bagels were stale. The construction on the adjacent road woke us each morning with jackhammers; the folks upstairs weren't that noisy - but in a building this old, there is little (if any) sound insulation. Parking per night is $17.... ouch. We had prepaid through booking.com and so no refund was available - otherwise we definitely would not have stayed more than one night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel near downtown”
Reviews.Author: Niepez
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for three nights. The hotel is located near Yonge Street and just a few steps from the subway. All in all the hotel appears old, but it is very clean and comfortable. The breakfast offers a fair choice, although there is only plastic cutlery available. The noise level in the room was moderate.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: linahan
Reviews.Content: the hotel is near the subway,very nice clean room,and the staffs in the hotel are very friendly and helpful,willing to answer our questions about the city or area restaurants..they aslo booked a very nice trip for me to the nigara falls. I really like the breakfast in the hotel. Have everything i want for a breakfast.the only thing i don't like is the elevtor. It's to small. Anyway. i would like to stay in this hotel for my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: MeganMcMahon27
Reviews.Content: The woman at the front desk who was always working was my biggest problem. She was rude and not knowledgable at all. When we checked in we learned there was no parking in the hotel. We had to park across the street in the public parking where you had to repay every morning and evening so you couldn't just pay for a whole 24 hour period. The exchange rate at the hotel was poor so it ended up costing us a lot to park across the street. We had to wake up at 7am to buy a new parking pass each day. The second day we were there I asked if there was any parking available (there is limited parking at the hotel, first come first serve). She got irritated with me for asking and then told me she "didn't think there was any" but refused to look. In other words we ended up paying for parking the entire time we were there. The "continental breakfast" consists of eggos and bad bagels. Our TV remote barely worked until one day we came back from the day out and the batteries were no longer in it. Also you should be aware that there are a great many rooms in the basement. There are only a few stories so it is likely you will be put in the basement where we were. The rooms down there were fine if you don't mind not having a window. Also the neighborhood you are in is far from the city... about a mile or two walk. It was fine for us since we're used to walking being from Chicago but the neighborhood wasn't great... when we arrived hungry there were no restaurants for us to go to upon our arrival. If you ask anyone from Toronto you'll learn its located in a very bad neighborhood of the city. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and ver cleen rooms”
Reviews.Author: robert24152424
Reviews.Content: If igo to toronto back my first choice wil be clarion hotel

Reviews.Title: “excellent located hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bigbigfellow
Reviews.Content: great location and execellent service!!! love it!!!

Reviews.Title: “it's a really nice place to stay..”
Reviews.Author: little_puppy_94
Reviews.Content: nice location, near the subway.. very polite ppl works there... room r clean and nice.. especially, the price is very reasonable... i would say it's a fine hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Most I Ever Spent on a Terrible Room”
Reviews.Author: heidigoseek
Reviews.Content: The halls smell like death. The room was tiny. Despite a lot of other promotional things I've seen on this hotel, there is not a microwave and fridge in every room. There was construction outside our window that overlooked a massive hole. The air conditioning was loud, the room was hot, and there was no way to open the windows (we could open the bathroom window, but again there was a massive, and loud construction pit under our window). The staff was disinterested. The wireless internet did not work for me at all. I was not impressed with the breakfast which was packed of carbohydrates, there was little fruit or protein. The parking lot was tiny and overpriced. I had a difficult time getting my car out without nearly hitting several vehicles. The only real redeeming aspect of this hotel is that it was easy to flee, close to the subway, and we didn't have to stay there all day. The hotel is moderately priced, but I don't think it's a good value for what you do pay.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Service and Location-- Nice Room Too!”
Reviews.Author: K-Hobo
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect place to stay for my business trip to a location on Younge Street. Great location and great service. I had to park for the day so I liked having a parking spot on the premises, even though it cost me extra $$$. The manager was friendly and professional, exchanging some American $$$ for Canadian and giving me a 10% off coupon for a local restaurant. The hotel is rather old, but it is clean and well-kept and has a generally good atmosphere. My room was clean and spacious-- the closet alone is bigger than some rooms I've stayed in in other hotels. Free wireless internet helped out. Lots of channels on the TV. The bed-- OK. You can here the people walking around upstairs from time to time but considering the price I paid for this room (less than $100) I was very satisfied and would definitely stay here again anytime I come back to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location”
Reviews.Author: Slo76
Reviews.Content: Nice old hotel,very close to subway,bus. The hotel is old,not on the outside,but on the inside.Rooms are clean,bed and bathroom are nice.The are a few cracks on the walls and the paint is falling off on some places. The only bad thing about this hotel are the room floors.You can hear every step in room above you,and i mean every step.

Reviews.Title: “Definetly recommend to friends and family”
Reviews.Author: JENNoh
Reviews.Content: First of all, price was very reasonable compare to location. It was located in downtown and just a minute walk to subway station which was really convenient and walk distance to Eaton shopping mall. Also, one I really liked about this hotel is great customer service!! They serve guests with just right degree of friendliness and courtesy. If you choose this hotel, just bring your laptop then you can use Wifi for free Overall, I will give 4 star out of 5!

Reviews.Title: “It was OK for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Jovanel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in April 2009 for the week-end, Friday-Sunday. The hotel ended up costing $72/night (Canadian). The location is great for leisure travelers to Toronto. I used to live in the city so I know that the price is pretty decent for being downtown. The parking at the time of my stay was $13+tax per night. If you want to get up early and move your car by 7am there is a lot across the street that's a flat rate of $6/night from 6pm-7am. The lot seemed safe enough, and there was nothing about the area that made me feel uneasy being a lone female traveler. The parking lot at the hotel is small, I estimate about 25 spaces that are on a first come first serve basis. It's also cramped so large vehicles would be difficult to manouever. If you don't have a car, the area is actually more convienient as the entrance to the Sherbourne subway station is right across the street from the hotel. Also, the hotel is about 2 blocks from Yonge & Bloor--this is a busy area with lots of restaurants, bars, pubs, and shops. That area of Yonge is pretty busy until about 3:30 am on the week-ends. Also a pretty safe area to walk in at night; however, it's downtown in a big city, so I would advise being cautious just as a general rule. The hotel is an easy walk (about 20 min.) to the Royal Ontario Museum (the ROM). Within an hour or less of walking you can also walk to the Eaton Centre or the theatre district, so a cab ride wouldn't be too much. Currently there's a lot of roadwork going on in the area so getting around by car is VERY slow and the Don Valley Parkway (highway that runs north/south and connects to the 401) closes a lot on the week-ends for construction--so it makes traveling by vehicle in and out of downtown sow and tedious unless your more familiar with the area and are comfortable taking residential roads. The hotel itself is quite old. It was originally built in the 1870's as a private home and then eventually converted into a hotel. Due to it's age there are quirks and things that go along with that; like the very small elevator that holds 5 people and has the old-school type door that opens like a regular door and has a sliding cage you have to push aside to get in--the doors don't open automatically. The continental breakfast included in the room price is OK to get you started; it has coffee/juices, toast, bagels, yogurt, cereal, frozen waffles (like Eggo's), and hard boiled eggs. Breakfast seems to be served from 7am-10am on the week-ends. I find that the area of the hotel is very quite for being right downtown. You don't really hear any street noise. The room I was in was small. It had a small desk, a large sliding door closet with a double mirror on it, 1 double bed, a TV (27" I think), and a air conditioner/heating unit. The bathroom had a shelf above the toilet, a pedistal sink, and only a stand-up shower (no bath tub). I did not like the shower curtain as it was light cloth and tended to be sucked into the shower and touches you, which I find kind of gross. The furnishings and carpeting are kind of old and have that worn-in look. The room in general was clean enough, there was a couple stray hairs in the bathroom and the back of the TV and the heating/cooling unit was dusty. The building also used to be a girls school and the rooms are kind or dormitory-style, rather than what you would expect at a Days Inn or something. There was a computer in the lobby that seemed to have internet and appeared to be available for anyone's use, though I didn't use it myself. I didn't have much interaction with the staff, as I didn't have any problems or need to ask any questions so I'm not sure how helpfull they are. The over-all look of the hotel is also kind of worn. As it is an old building there are cracks and parts that are uneven, and creaks; but it's not horrible. I would recommend the place more for travelers without little children (say under the age of 10). There seemed to be a lot of 20-somethings staying there--probably because of it's low cost, and proximity to night-life. I'm not sure that I would call it a 3-star hotel, but for the price and the area it's in I thought that it was decent. I don't have any significant complaints. Oh, there are raccoons in the area--especially the parking lot. They don't seem dangerous, but they can startle you. In all, the hotel is OK. I recommend it if you want to stay somewhere different that's not a cookie-cutter Holiday Inn. I don't think I'd like to stay there longer than 3 or 4 nights, but I think it's pretty good for a week-end stay.

Reviews.Title: “Subterrenean experience”
Reviews.Author: NYMotherFussers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for five nights in fall 2005, during the Toronto International Film Fest. We were there to get my H1-B visa, and wanted to spend as little money as possible. After reading that the hotel use to house Hemingway, we decided it was probably not too bad. Rate: Very inexpensive. You get what you pay for though. Parking: It was a very small parking lot, and it was difficult to maneuver around the other cars. Check-in: There was a bit of a delay at the check-in. They couldn't find our reservation. Room: We entered into a room with one window near the top of the ceiling--which meant that the room was below street level. There was a full-sized bed and an updated bathroom. The room was very dark even in the middle of the day. Cleanliness: The room and bathroom seemed clean enough, although the carpet looked suspect. Breakfast: Included with the rate, and served in a basement room. Cereal, fruit and jouce provided. Location: Great. Neighborhood felt safe, and the subway was just around the corner. Post-stay: We barely used the room except for sleeping, so the stay wasn't completely unbearable, but in hindsight, we wwould have been better off spending more money to stay at a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting hotel, lovely decor, quiet, definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: Angelos170
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nicely centrally located and surprisingly quiet. The staff was friendly and courteous. AND it was a great value! Though I was not a fan of being told on the phone that parking was free and then getting there and it was really $15/day.

Reviews.Title: “A few quirks but”
Reviews.Author: HippoCat
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent value hotel for Toronto. Very clean and accessible by public transit... hop off the subway at Sherbourne and the hotel is literally across the street! The location was great. Close to the downtown core or about a 20 minute walk to Bloor-Yorkville or a quick subway ride to Greektown/ Danforth area. My partner and I had no safety concerns walking in the area even at night. Now for the the hotel itself. If you are looking for a 5-star experience you you may be disappointed. The hotel is an old building and like any older building there are quirks and cracks. For example, the bathroom door closed but there was a fairly large space between the top of the door and the door jam. There are cracks in the walls and a few water stains on ceiling but in perspective it is all cosmetic. Our room was a good size, clean and quiet. Each room has its own heating- cooling unit. The queen size bed was a pillow top mattress and very comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. There is a computer in the lobby that you can use for free or there is wireless available. Breakfast was good and free (nothing fancy). However I think the best thing about the hotel is the price... we stayed for two nights with a total charge of $150 and you would be hard pressed to find somewhere else this clean with your own bathroom for that price downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good room, great affordability”
Reviews.Author: RobertPelletier
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Clarion for 2 nights, with my boyfriend. We enjoyed the neighborhood, very close to the Village. We enjoyed the good size room with a very clean bathroom. Bed was comfortable, breakfast was ok. Over all, a very nice experience! We actyally paid 180$ for two nights,tax included, wich is very very good for such a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: brentiesuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first two nights of our stay in Toronto. We booked through Wot-if.com and paid via that website however this did cause a slight problem on check in as the desk clerk could not find our booking immediately. However this was soon rectified and we were even upgraded to a suite for our trouble, I was surprised as a few of the reviews on here have not given the staff a good rating however I could not fault them they were very polite and friendly. The suite was the Hemingway suite at the front of the building which was very pleasant. The rooms were very large and spacious, the bed linen was beautifully crisp and clean and the bathroom spotless - all in all very nice. The price we paid and the location were first class. The hotel was immediately opposite the subway station. The area itself is old and a little run down however if you stay here you must eat in the Ground Hog Bar just around the corner. Friendly relaxed atmosphere and really good food at very reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Clarion Selby”
Reviews.Author: lilywaterloo
Reviews.Content: Our rooms were dirty, the carpets stained and the wall paper was peeling off. We had no closet, the room was not much bigger that the bed and the art work consisted of an ironing board. Overall a most disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good travellers hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jacalope
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel from 19 - 24 October 08. I recommend it for travellers though I think it may fall short for the average business traveller. The location is good, 1 block off Bloor on Sherbourne, 1 block to the Sherbourne subway station, in downtown Toronto. A cab ride to the CN Tower/Go Train area is about $15 (depending on traffic) and a subway ride is quick and easy ($2.75). The hotel is an heritage property with an interesting history. Hand in hand with that, it is an old building. The hallways are uneven (as a result of much use), the walls have been painted many times and there are some cracks in walls and tiles. It is clean and well cared for. The clientele was very international with some apparent business travellers but predominately apparent leisure travellers. There were many different languages heard at breakfast. Speaking of breakfast, it was quite good. There were three kinds of juice - orange, apple and cranberry (NOT fresh squeezed like the website says), eggs (during my stay they were hard boiled), eggos, bread and bagels for toasting as well as croissants and cereal. To top it all off there was jam, cream cheese syrup etc. My room was clean and large with a coffee maker in the room. The heat is provided by a heater/air conditioner in the window ... it is a bit noisy with the fan but easy to control. The bed was comfy and the pillows a bit flat. The front desk staff were very helpful with cabs, questions and wake-up calls. This the sort of place I stay at when I travel for leisure. If you have any questions, feel free to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: mickstout
Reviews.Content: Booked this room through HotelTravel.com and got a room for only $80 per night. The young lady at the check-in counter clearly didn't want to be at work that day but she was polite. The room we got was in the basement. So no view of course. The entire hotel is a smoke-free environment so going outside for a smoke from the basement was a pain in the neck too. However, a late night smoke led to an encounter with a racoon, which was cool. Our room didn't have a refrigerator. That was rather annoying. The breakfast was self serve: hard boiled eggs, bagels, toast, coffee. The coffee wasn't great but it was drinkable. I've certainly had worse. The breakfast was complimentary so no complaints. At the end of the day, I was very satisfied with this hotel because the price was very cheap considering the location. Couldn't have asked for a better location really.

Reviews.Title: “They made an unauthorized charge on my credit card”
Reviews.Author: ClarionSucks
Reviews.Content: These people are crooks; if you stay here, prepared to be screwed over. My husband and I live in Toronto, but wanted to have a nice night away, so we booked a night at the Clarion. We liked the hotel - it was a fine stay. The staff wasn't overly friendly, and the 'continental' breakfast in the basement wasn't the best meal, but it was fine for a budget place. Then, they made an unauthorized charge on my credit card. BEFORE I WAS EVEN CHECKED OUT, they charged me $30.00, without my consent. I charged the cost of the room to my credit card, and when I checked my statement, I phoned the hotel to find out why I had this extra charge. They then accused me of stealing a blanket (in late May? We don't want their icky hotel blanket with god-knows-what-bodily-fluids on it! We brought a backpack for 2 people, as we only needed to bring our toiletries and a change of clothes. Where would we pack this big blanket, to smuggle it out? Why would we steal a blanket when we live in the same city?). We did not steal the blanket, so I was more than a little upset to be not only accused of theft, but charged $30!! I have phoned the hotel repeatedly, with no one to help me. One manager told me that she believes I didn't steal the blanket, and can't explain the charge. I believe they are trying to extort money from guests this way. Check your credit card statements, or better yet, don't leave them your credit card information.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: penicilling
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Selby for a night before my important meeting. I booked it online and it was one of the good discounts in downtown toronto. The neighborhood is largely residential, and if you are looking for views, all you may get is view of other apartments (or nothing if in the basement) but if you do not care, this is a good value for money. My purpose was to relax and prepare for my meeting. I feel, I could find no better place. It is next door to the subway and you can reach within 10 minutes from the Union station after making a change at Bloor-Yonge station. The staff provides excellent services (I was offer an upgrade as I did not like the room I was offered!) The rooms are maintained perfectly spotless. Breakfast was more than adequate, fresh and of a very good quality. Check in and check out is easy and does not take more than a minute each way if you booked online. I would recommend this place to anyone visiting Toronto without a car and wishing to stay in the downtown area with easy access to public transport and peaceful neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: typewithnospaces
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because of the convenience to the subway system, close to the gay district, and the quaintness of it. After traversing the steps up to the lobby (We were on our honeymoon and had lots of luggage). We were pleasantly greeted and permitted to check into our rooms earlier, the front desk gave an excellent recommendation for a lunch spot. The room was on the top floor, and we took the "eclectic" little elevator (mind you this use to be a residence that was turned into a hotel). There were small notions about the hotel that gave to it's age - not in a bad way, like crooked door hangs, but the doors were set to fit. The maid service was wonderful, rooms always left very clean. We enjoyed the historical aspects of the hotel. The breakfast was minimal, but a nice snack. I liked that they had cranberry juice. We decided to extend our stay an additional day. The staff is extremely friendly, and willing to give local recommendations. I highly recommend using the transit system, excellent and runs often (like every few minutes), but do expect to be like ants going in and out of trains or buses (we live in Atlanta so were use to riding the subway). The city was very clean and everyone very friendly. Don't be afraid to ask for directions or suggestions. Side note for those that enjoy military history, visit St Michaels and go to the museum in the basement - the folks there served in the military and are very proud to share all the history and pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: nathaliemc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my birthday as well as my one year anniversary with my boyfriend and I was so upset when I got there. The parking lot is so tiny that it feels like only Tonka Toys would fit properly. If you have a big truck or van good luck trying to fit in their parking lot. The breakfast that is included in the stay consists of orange juice and dry cereals. Not impressed! Also when we finally got to our room it was in the basement. I went to look outside and there was nothing but a brick wall outside of the window. Very dissapointed again. The room was clean and suitable but not what i was expecting. They also claim to have elevators but they aren't elevators at all they are lifts the size of small closets. I didn't trust it at all so we took the stairs. I am a size three waist and I could barely fit inside the elevator let alone bring my boyfriend and our luggage. Like i said we felt safer taking the stairs. I dont reccomend this to anyone unless you are prepared for the above or looking for a place to crash after a party.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful what you wish for”
Reviews.Author: BeldarTheButler
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks wonderful on its website. And some rooms may well resemble the photos. However, if you book a special rate (as we did, through AAA), you may wind up (as we did) in the basement, in a very simple room whose only window -- screwed shut -- looked into an interior laundry/maintenance area. Yes, it was clean and quiet, but the place was worn and tired: one small, rickety elevator, numerous steps to negotiate to get to that elevator (your roll-aboard won't help you here), internal security doors, a crowded, unpatrolled outdoor parking lot on a busy streeet, and a dismal breakfast offering (also in the basement). At least it's relatively close to the Toronto subway, which we could "feel" in our room. Probably a good example of "You get what you pay for."

Reviews.Title: “Downtown”
Reviews.Author: phow
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very comfortable and clean. The rooms are a good size with a large washroom and clothing closet. There is a hair dryer and a iron/board in the room. Each room also has a coffee pot and replenished coffee/tea. We actually really liked the hotel because we didn't need to ask for anything. We did not however find the staff helpful as my husband asked if he could use the microwave and was told by a male staff at the front desk that they didn't have a working microwave (?!?!). We had also been promised a microwave and fridge in our room when we booked. However when we checked in they weren't in the room and were out of each. Should they get one for us we were going to be charged $10 each. The breakfast was adequate but not very good. I would suggest they leave hard boiled eggs in the shell so they could stay warmer, cover the bread and stop using stale croissants. The juice and cereals are good. Can't beat this hotel for area as it's across the street from the Bloor/Sherbourne subway line and the Sherbourne bus runs right in front of the hotel. We'd stay here again but get breakfast elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to send visiting parents”
Reviews.Author: mantaraggio
Reviews.Content: When my parents came to visit me in Toronto I sent them to this hotel. Not only is it a block away from where I live, but it's across the street from the subway station, in walking distance of the shopping on Bloor Street, and one of the more inexpensive hotels near the downtown area. Plus I knew my mother would love the old mansion that houses the hotel. My parents asked for a room with a queen bed and ended up in one of the suites with a fireplace and a jacuzzi for the same price. They seemed less than enthusiastic about the breakfast, but there are plenty of yummy places for brunch around so they didn't mind too terrible. For a cheaper hotel in the same location, try the Isabella Hotel down the block.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky old hotel”
Reviews.Author: proudy74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Clarion at the end of our holiday. The main reason for visiting Toronto was to go to Niagara Falls on our way back to the UK so we only stayed 2 nights. The hotel has a lot of character and is quite quirky. The front desk were helpful enough and the service was generally polite and friendly. There was free use of the internet which is always nice. Breakfast was fairly limited with little choice. There was a very wide range of nations staying at the hotel whilst we were there which made for some interesting conversations at the toaster! The room was fine with a very good air con unit - the day we arrived it was 91F and the room was like a sauna but within seconds the unit had it feeling like an icebox! Location-wise the hotel is about 10-15 minutes walk from the main shopping streets around Yonge and Dundas, however there is a subway station pretty much across the street which gives good access to downtown. If you're only going to be in Toronto for a couple of nights this hotel is fine, but anything longer and you might wish to consider somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and very practical”
Reviews.Author: Cobos
Reviews.Content: Very happy with our stay in this hotel. The hotel does look a bit wierd and "unfinished" at times but it was always in perfect working order. A typical example is the door frame to our suite which looked like it was all bent out of shape, and thus the door should be a few millimeters from stuck. But after seeing the frame I checked the door and it opens and closes perfectly without even a sound. The old building has probably shifted and they kept the door frame as is and adjusted the door. There was no mention of breakfast at the website but when we arrived there was a free breakfast service. A good selection of different food as well, but they used plastic cutlery. Everywhere you looked things might seem a bit strange, but the service level was very good. We did have a slight problem with a special offer from Clarions website not sticking to the booking, but great help from the receptionist staff and they got that sorted. Not very central location but subway station was only 1.5 blocks away so still very convenient. Would surely stay here again. We did get a free upgrade from room to 2-room suite for free (thought I'd mention that as well).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: EdmTraveller101
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Toronto Selby for a 3 night stay in August 2007. Booked directly through the hotel website for a queen room on a higher floor and such was honored upon arrival at the hotel. The hotel itself is an old mansion that has been converted into a hotel and an addition was added as well to enlarge the space for the hotel. The common areas of the hotel are well kept up but are also decorated in an antique type style which I believe adds to the charm of the hotel. The lobby is tastefull decorated in antique furniture and draperies and is very cozy if you want to just sit and relax at any time. The hotel also provides a guest computor with free internet access 24/7 which is also placed in the lobby. My room was small (by normal standards) but extremely clean and cozy. In addition to the queen bed, there was an armiore with a TV, a writing desk, a small fridge and microwave, and coffee maker. The bathroom provided ample towels and toiletries which were replentished daily if needed. The room also had a walk in closet, which I think was almost the size of the bathroom and provided more than plenty of room to store your luggage and any clothing you wished to hang up or put on the provided shelving. The hotel also provided a complimentary breakfast in their breakfast room each morning. **There have been previous reviews about the content, etc of the breakfast, however, I have to say, I thought it was great, and I AM fussy about this sort of thing. The room was nicely set up; there were several kinds of both hot and cold cereal, muffins, breads, bagels pastries, hardboiled eggs, sausage patties, several kinds of juices and yogurt, and many kinds of tea, in addition to regular coffee, provided with REAL cream and sugar. It was more than sufficient to start the day. There were also staff present in the breakfast room restocking items as they ran low. The location of the hotel itself is just off Bloor Street in what I would describe as an older part of downtown Toronto but the area had alot to offer in terms of restaurants, local pubs, and the subway about a block down the street to get you anywhere in Toronto you wanted to go. Overall, if you're looking for a clean, quiet, and well priced hotel, this is it. I'm not sure where the negative reviews come from, but my stay here was exceptionally positive. The staff there are extremely helpful and accomodate all of your requests and questions without any hesitation. I've also noticed that despite the negative reviews, no one ever puts any pictures on here to portray the accuracy of their complaints, so have decided to put some on that will portray the good the hotel has to offer. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “a unique experience”
Reviews.Author: SenoraSofia
Reviews.Content: We are here now at the Clarion Selby in Toronto. I am sitting in a very elegant lobby full of antiques, hearing numerous foreign languages, using the complementary wireless from my laptop. There is a "business center" in the lobby: a computer and printer free to be used by guest. It is situated on a handsome antique desk. I purchased my two night stay from the WCNY public broadcast fundraiser in January 2007. This stay is a great contrast to our usual casino resort stays... and we like it. We are fortunate to have a room in the mansion section of the hotel. I would guess there are 10 or 15 rooms in the mansion. I had requested a King bed, but was offered a queen in the mansion.
