I jumped to take it. The room is small but that is no problem. The bathroom is huge and appears to have been recently renovated. I always look for elements to incorporate in my home renovations. In this bathroom, I like the silver and gold water fixtures. Also, the tile work is very nicely designed and installed. The closet is a riot. It is big and appears unchanged for 100+ years. I told my husband, "this closet is as big as the bathroom I had in Hotel City in Netherlands last year." Whatever has been written negative about the complimentary breakfast is not current. My husband and I carried our room coffee mugs to the breakfast after reading that the foam cups were not good. But, the disposable coffee cups were a nice type. Also, someone had reported at this site or another review site that they did not give real cream with the coffee. We purchased milk at a market nearby for the coffee, but there was nice cream at the breakfast buffet. The buffet included: croissant, bagels, four cereals including Mueslix, apples, hard boiled eggs, mini yogurts, juices, apples, jams, peanut butter, honey, and the list goes on. It was a very nice offering and a pleasantly clean little dining room. Upon arrival, everyone at the front desk worked to help us out. There was an issue of the value of our package, and it was handled well. The parking arrangement was to our liking. We were assigned the spot we had parked it. We were given a key to view the "Hemingway room". This was what attracted us to this hotel. We are great fans of Ernest Hemingway's writing. (In 1976 I followed his path in Southern Spain, going to places he had visited, talking to people who had served him - mostly bartenders.). Anyway, it has been 30+ years since being on the Hemingway path and was great to see his room: beautiful antique furniture, many windows looking down on the street, a windowed "porch" room with a desk. We imagined him writing here for the Toronto Star. We did not get a good look at the bathroom, but it didn't look as modern as the renovation in our room. I believe the value of our room is $149 per night. I would say it is a fair price. If you are accustomed to the modern and large hotel room, this might be a shock. In the words of my husband, "I would have never chosen this hotel because I am a hotel snob." He is a frequent business and casino resort traveler. But, he too is greatly enjoying this hotel experience. Thank you to the Toronto Clarion and Haroon Latif for your donation to the Arts in Central New York. I have seen this hotel offered annually at the WCNY fundraising event. I am fortunate to have been the high bidder this year.

Reviews.Title: “great holiday”
Reviews.Author: twin1Uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the clarion for 11 nights and had a wonderful stay. The staff were really friendly and helpful. The maid came every day and the towels and sheets were always clean. The breakfast was a nice extra it had cereals toast yogurts etc and was a good start to the day. The hotel is on the outskirts of downtown so we had to catch the tube every day which was no problem, a weekly pass only costs 30 dollars. A taxi from the airport to the hotel cost 55 dollars make sure you ask for a fixed rate first. The groundhog around the corner is a nice local bar where you can eat and have a drink the locals there were very friendly. I would recommend the hotel we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location and price excellent - staff rather unexperienced”
Reviews.Author: Littlezuster
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only 3 nights. The location is excellent for exploring Toronto as well as it's surroundings - and this at a very reasonable price. Unfortunately you will find no parking spots around the hotel and the hotel itself charges you approx. 14 CAN$ daily for theirs. The last night was rather unpleasant: some teenagers stayed at the hotel and what started as a Friday Night party soon developped into a severe screaming, yelling, running and whatsoever through the whole hotel. Even though we informed the front desk already at 11 pm - they were unable to solve the problem without several additional appeals and it was almost 4 am when we finally were able to sleep => the police took about 25 teenagers to jail this night. Well, we felt the front desk staff was simply unexperienced how to deal with those problems. For a componsation they did not charge us the parking fees - and we were allowed to check out as late as we wanted the next morning. As we guess those events are quite unusual, we will not overestimate this :-) The hotel is good - you just have to take the parking fees into account - but it will still be an unbeatable price for this location.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't Great, but, Not Horrible Either”
Reviews.Author: See_The_USA_2007
Reviews.Content: When searching for a downtown hotel in Toronto, I quickly realized that you can spend a ton of cash on the room, plus parking. So, when I spotted this property, I was happy that it was reasonably priced, a historic Victorian, across the street from the Bloor Street Subway Line, and it had designated parking for only $13/day. The Financial District hotels had city parking for $30/day and no in/out access. Sure, my actual room wasn't in the Victorian, it was in an addition that was used as a school many years ago, but, it was clean and comfortable. Yes, I agree, the breakfast was not good...but, it's fine for a quick cup of joe and some toast. There were a lot of reviews that stated the Front Desk staff were rude, non-helpful, etc. I didn't find that at all. They were nice people. All in all, I was happy with the hotel. Like most people, Canadians respond well to tourists that treat them with respect. The $200 GST added to my bill shocked me, but the hotel doesn't have any control over taxes imposed by the Canadian Government.

Reviews.Title: “No so great”
Reviews.Author: worleymg
Reviews.Content: Not a very nice hotel. The room was very small and the air conditioning was noisy. I thought the location was not very central and was disappointed. The breakfast was terrible. I did not find the staff helpful. I asked the receptionist where we could eat in the area and he said nothing near by at all! Very, very disappointed after reading all the previous reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Good Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: MonGOR
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and breakfast. The hotel is very charming with nice amenites. We loved the breakfast that was included in the price. We will be back in summer to enjoy Toronto and will stay in Clarion for sure.

Reviews.Title: “good location - bad service”
Reviews.Author: ronitm
Reviews.Content: we found the location most convenient. The subway station was next to the hotel + it was easy to get to most central places walking. Breakfast was good enough for us The room we got was big enough but it was a smoking room which smelled awful- especially that it was impossible to open any windows, even though we asked for a non smoking. The staff was rude and unhelpful : didn't make any effort to change the room. I had asked twice for a blanket before going down and picking one myself. what we found outrageous was the fact the our room hadn't been made up till 4:45 pm. When we complained we were told that was the policy of the hotel. All in all, the price was reasonable and the room was good enough but the staff is bad.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for some days...”
Reviews.Author: StiflersMom
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights in October in the 3rd floor with a "nice" view to a wall about 3 meter opposite the window. The room itself is very small - but there is a huge closet for the luggage and clothes. Also the bathroom was very large and recently renovated - everything was clean. Amenities include free highspeed wireless internet, coffeemaker, ironing equipment, hair-dryer, 60 TV channels, breakfast and a parking lot in front of the hotel as long as availible for about 13 CAN Dollars. Rooms are a bit noisy - it's an old building so everything is very aslope. The gap between the doors - you can stick your whole hand through. We can not recommend our room in winter. The bathroom has no heating, and to heat the room you have to turn on the air conditioner which was very loud even in the lowest setting. Too loud to sleep - but that drowned out the noise from the floor and other rooms. However.... Breakfast was in a room somewhere in the basement labyrinth - nothing special. They accurate close the door at 10 am - so don't sleep too long. Subway Station "Sherway" is only about 100m to the left across the street. We only needed the staff for check-in and out. That was ok - no complaints about that.

Reviews.Title: “Attitude”
Reviews.Author: Lili_Marlen
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Toronto two nights the week before Labor Day when my boyfriend and I were traveling through Canada. We chose this hotel because it was not ridiculously expensive like the rest of the other hotels in the city. We booked 1 queen bedroom with tax and parking included for 128 Canadian $ per night. Also, the reviews on tripadvisor werenâ€™t terrible, most of them were complains about the front desk people. I thought to myself: â€œit canâ€™t be that bad, I donâ€™t have to interact so much with them is just two nightsâ€� â€¦Well check out the part below. Pluses: This place is near Bloor St. a gay neighborhood with nice places to eat. Metro is just blocks away. And, I was very pleased with the size of the room. Ours had a huge closet that included an iron & ironing board and a nice size bathroom. The room looked very nice and clean. Minuses: This place is very far from the cool Queen and College Streets, Hipster Kensington Market or awesome Chinatown. You have to walk a lot to get there, or take other means of transportation. The front desk people do have an attitude problem, let me expand below. When I checked in, I told the front desk guy that my print out of the reservation said smoker room, but I had selected non-smoker. He rolled his eyes and with an accusatory tone he said â€�Ohh, it is smoker because you chose smokerâ€� Why does he have to be argumentative when we both know what the outcome of things will be, he will just change the rooms, right? In a really class A service hotel, the way they do it is like this â€�Itâ€™s okay, I can change itâ€� A hotel with great customer service wants the guest to feel taken care of, not belittlle or make them feel stupid. Terrible attitude. Then at checked out there is sign in the front office that says â€œWe support fair exchangeâ€� and has the quote of the exchange rate that was very reasonable. I want to pay in cash with my Canadian dollars when I noticed that I donâ€™t have enough. My boyfriend decides to get rid of his American cash (he brought a lot) and pay the bill pointing at the sign. The front desk guy is following all our conversation. After my boyfriend paid for the bill in US$, and the guy gives us our receipt and the left over change he says: â€œOh, by the way thatâ€™s an old rate, we havenâ€™t changed in a while" This is of course after he has charged us and given us the crappiest exchange rate. Scummiest bastard. Also: When I was waiting to check out, there was a woman in front of me ranting at one of the front desk people about her parking space being in another lot and how they have lied to her all along on other things, the awful service, etc, etc. She went on saying: â€œI am telling you all this, but you know what,.. I know you donâ€™t careâ€� I agree; they donâ€™t care.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place.......”
Reviews.Author: ThePoppitts
Reviews.Content: This hotel is easy to get to via the subway, as it is located opposite Sherbourne Station. Check in was fine with no problems. The room was spacious but smelt very musty the entire time. Bathroom was quite spacious and there was a good walk in wardrobe. Beds were comfy, and there was a tea/coffee maker. Decor in room and hotel in general was tired but not too scruffy. Breakfast was nasty. You helped yourself but everything was on polystyrene plates and in polystyrene cups. The food had got warm, which when serving things like cream-cheese is rather dangerous! Breakfast room is too small for all the people staying in the hotel. We only had breakfast the first day and didn't bother with it after that. One lady working reception was quite rude and sarcastic when we asked if we could settle our bill the night before we were due to leave (owing to us checking out very early in the morning). There is no need for rudeness and sarcasm to paying guests! All in all, the location was good and - regarding the hotel - you basically got what you paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: blues1492
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Clarion in May'06 and must say the hotel was well worth the price. Got a good deal from Expedia. The Clarion a few blocks from the commercial streets of Toronto so you can rest quietly at night. It's only 1 block away from the subway station (Sherbourne) which was a great plus for getting the city. Not much too do around the area though. Just a few stores and a supermarket that's about it. However, if you plan to hang around the city and need a place to sleep like I did then no worries on that. The hotel provided free breakfast (always my fav) and every morning there is a free Toronto newspaper outside your door. If you're a news junkie like me that's way better than a cup of coffee. The attendants at the front desk were very nice and answered any questions presented. If I return to Toronto I would definitely stay at the Clarion Hotel & Suites Selby. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fine”
Reviews.Author: norton_lees
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a stay in the Clarion and have to say hotel was fine. Offers great location, and would concur on very helpful and friendly staff. Not the most modern, building is certainly interesting architecturally, and the lift is great fun. Got to ask yourself what do you want for your money? this offers a great value option and I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “very victorian”
Reviews.Author: Gsphaire
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Clarion with my finance for the weekend. The staff was very friendly and professional we had a suite with a Jacuzzi and fire place, the suite was very suspicious creating Victorian image, very impressive. A lot of shopping and restaurants are within walking distance of the hotel as well the public transportation (Subway). The subway being across the hotel is a big help and saving, in terms of transportation to the airport. We almost saved a $100 on cabs by using the subway. The price of the hotel is very competitive as compared to the quality and service provided while being in downtown. The staff at the hotel helped us a good deal in making reservations for our sightseeing and blue mountain trip. GOOD JOB GUYS!!!!! If we ever come back to Toronto we will definitely stay at the Clarion.

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind hotel”
Reviews.Author: xzxz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located at a great location. We loved the hotel of its uniqueness. Staff was great and helpful. We will stay again. Our car was safe for a week at the hotel. We do travel a lot and sensible enough, not to leave any valuables in the car visible. A brake in can happen at any place and any city. The price was great and the parking fee was reasonable. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Selby: an Epic.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful. We were a group of kids and still, the staff treated us with respect. The rooms were all nice. The rooms on the upper floors were nicer, I think. There was a wireless internet connection (perfect for teens who are constantly on MSN) The breakfast was okay.. nothing to write home about though. The location is awesome. The subway is a hop, skip and a jump away (literally.. we tried it.) We found ourself in the mall in about 5 minutes. The only thing I should warn you about is the parking area. You might want to take extra precautions when keeping your vehicle here. Lock it, use those fancy locks for your wheel..whatever. Our bus was left unlocked by a careless bus driver and we got many things stolen including a bass, a guitar and a projector. Just a little tip =)

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is a low, low end property to say the least. I live in a Victorian home and to call this property historically quaint is a huge stretch. Run down and seedy would be more accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff & cosy rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me & my boyfriend were visiting toronto over the weekend of july28-august 2. We had booked the clarion for queen size room for 2 of the nights. The staff was very helpful and processed our check-in and check out quickly. The room was very clean and cosy as so was the washroom. The staff also let us leave our luggage at their store room when we checked out so that we didnt have to carry our bags when we went outside to roam downtown. The free breakfast wasnt much to talk about. But it was a good start to the day with a cream cheese bagel & orange juice. It is located right across the sherbourne subway so getting around downtown toronto was very simple. In short, we loved our stay at the clarion and we truly recomment it.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: catelpa
Reviews.Content: We wanted to try the Clarion Selby because we had lived across the street in 1980 when "The Selby" was a run-down tavern. We moved away from Toronto, but noticed during our return visits recently that this area of Toronto, and especially "The Selby" had undergone an extreme transformation for the better ... so we booked our stay at the Clarion Selby to check it out. On checking in, the desk attendant was unable to find any indication of our reservation but, non-plussed, proceeded to arrange for us to stay in one of larger suites at the same rate. The room was absolutely fantastic .... meanwhile, the front desk had cleared up the kerfuffle with our reservation. We had a wonderful stay at "The Selby" and recommend it to anyone who does not feel obligated to blow $200 to $300 ( or more !!) per night for a safe, clean place to sleep while staying in downtown Toronto. Park your car in the lot (only $13 per night) and walk, take the tube, or taxi anywhere you feel the urge go.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual & Nice”
Reviews.Author: dbakerca
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on May 25 & 26, 2005. I chose it as I am a member of the ChoiceClub plan and this was the closest Choice Hotel to where I was attending business meetings. The location of this hotel is very good - only one block south of Bloor Street and a ten minute walk from Yonge Street. The pros - 1. Clean, quiet and comfortable; 2. Very friendly and accomodating staff; 3. Unique nature as it is a historically designated building (whle not seeming too old inside); 4. Location in a residential / boutique area; 5. Value - My room was $108 per night including a good continential breakfast. The two cons - 1. The breakfast room itself. First, it is not the room on the main floor marked "Breakfast Room". The room I eventually found was in the basement and was not very appealling; 2. The parking - There are not many parking spaces at this hotel and they have been arranged rather higgily-piggily around the building. This made for some tight maneuvering even with a small car. Would I stay here again? Yes, the five pros listed well outweighed the two cons. If you are not a hotel snob, this hotel will do just fine.
